business.headline: GST 2.0: Essentials cheaper, but these items will now cost moreWhile essentials will see meaningful relief, everyday indulgences and luxury items will carry heavier taxes.

GST cuts drive auto sector rally: Top stocks to keep on your radarWith the festive season approaching, experts believe that automobile companies will be among the biggest winners of the recent rate cuts in GST.

Sensex, Nifty extend gains as GST cut optimism fuels Dalal Street rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained nearly 300 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 climbed past 24,800, signalling the possibility of a fresh rally if a favourable outcome emerges on the US tariff front.

Oracle, Salesforce cut hundreds of jobs in US as tech layoffs drag on: ReportIn filings with state regulators, the two software giants disclosed plans to eliminate more than 500 jobs in the Bay Area and nearly 200 in the Seattle region. Salesforce is cutting 262 roles in San Francisco, while Oracle is eliminating 254 jobs spread across Redwood City, Pleasanton and Santa Clara.
How will you invest in US? Trump presses tech titans at White House dinnerAt a White House dinner with top tech CEOs, Donald Trump pressed Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft on their US investments.

What after Armani: The way ahead for iconic Italian fashion empireGiorgio Armani, who died at 91 leaving no children, built one of the world's most iconic fashion brands and ensured its future independence through a foundation.

US scraps Biden-era plan mandating airlines to pay for flight disruptionsIn December, the US Department of Transportation under then-President Joe Biden sought public comment on the rulemaking process about whether airlines should be required to pay $200 to $300 for domestic delays of at least three hours and up to $775 for longer delays.

GST reforms: Will consumption and investment get a real boost? Experts debateA major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax, termed GST 2.0, has been initiated, which the government is calling a significant 'Diwali bonus' for consumers and the economy.

GST 2.0 is game-changing and transformational reform: Piyush GoyalIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV's Managing Editor Marya Shakil, Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal called GST 2.0 the most game-changing and transformational reform the country has seen in several decades.

GST 2.0 a game-changing reform for citizens and businesses: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has described the new GST 2.0 reforms as a "game-changing" move that will simplify taxes, reduce prices on daily essentials, and give a major boost to India's economy.

Zara, Lacoste, and other global brands face higher GST: ReportInternational names such as Zara, H&M, Levi's, Lacoste, Nike and Uniqlo could be directly impacted. These brands rely heavily on India's growing middle-class youth, who see branded apparel as a lifestyle upgrade but remain highly price-sensitive.

GST reforms commendable, will have far-reaching benefits: Anand SharmaIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, former Commerce Minister Anand Sharma provides his assessment of the next-generation GST reforms.

Sensex, Nifty end higher: Is GST 2.0 next big trigger for the economy?Speaking on the possible impact on the market closing show on BT TV, Vinit Bolinjkar, Head of Research at Ventura Securities, said the domestic economy is set for a strong rebound.

What are 'sin' goods? All you need to know about special 40% GST slabFrom September 22, 2025, India will have a simpler GST system with just two main rates and a special 40% slab. This top rate applies only to a few products, popularly known as 'sin goods'. Let's break it down.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as profit booking caps GST 2.0 rallyAnalysts said the day began on a strong note, with sweeping GST rate cuts fuelling broad-based buying in auto, FMCG, and consumer durable stocks. However, sustained selling pressure in the second half of trade eroded much of the early momentum.

GST 2.0 guide: What gets cheaper, costlier, and everything in betweenJust as the festival season approaches, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has delivered a comprehensive GST overhaul that will put more money back into the pockets of Indians.

Ghee-ST reforms big on celebrations, big on India's dairy battleIn a big boost to Indian households, the government is bringing down the rates of common goods by reducing the Goods and Services Tax (GST). The Modi government publicised it as a 'Historic Diwali Gift for the Nation'. Ghee, milk and other dairy products are synonymous with Indian festivals, and the relief comes amid India digging its heels on the dairy and farm sector in trade talks with the US.

GST 2.0 cuts cement costs: Will affordable housing get a push?The government's GST 2.0 reform has slashed tax on cement and steel from 28% to 18%. Developers say this could lower construction costs and revive demand in the struggling affordable housing segment. But will the benefits reach homebuyers?

Farmers get GST breather: Tractors, fruits and fertilisers turn affordableFollowing the latest GST announcement, farmers are expected to get relief as their cultivation costs will reduce. Farmers have long demanded lower taxes for the agriculture sector.

GST 2.0 completes the economic hat-trick: What it means for IndiansGST 2.0, combined with income tax relief and cheaper loans, delivers an economic hat-trick, making essentials affordable, boosting consumption, and signaling a new phase of growth and investor optimism in India

No GST on life and health insurance: Will your premiums really drop?Insurance buyers have reason to cheer as GST has been waived on life and health insurance policies. But will this move make premiums cheaper, or will the benefit be limited? Let's break it down.

Explained: Watching IPL live just got costlier thanks to new GST rulesCricket fans in India will now have to pay more to watch IPL matches live, after the government raised the GST on premium sporting events from 28% to 40%. A ticket that previously cost Rs 1,000 plus GST, bringing the total to Rs 1,280, will now set fans back Rs 1,400—a jump of Rs 120.
GST 2.0: Check list of all goods that are now tax-freeA key part of the reforms under GST 2.0 is the exemption of many essential goods and services from GST, moving them into the 0% tax category.

GST 2.0: 11 key FAQs you must knowWith new GST rates kicking in from 22 September 2025, the tax system is set for its biggest revamp in years. These 11 FAQs break down what's cheaper, what's costlier, and what it means for you.

From gyms to cycles, how GST reforms mirror PM's push for healthy IndiaThe latest GST overhaul, aligning with Prime Minister Modi's call for a fitter nation, slashes taxes on fitness, wellness services, and healthy food items to 5%.

Consumer and auto stocks in focus as GST bonanza lights up Dalal StreetThe Nirmala Sitharaman-led GST Council overhauled the complicated indirect tax regime, announcing sharp reductions in rates on food and daily essential items as well as consumer durables like TVs and refrigerators.

Not just small cars, big cars also cheaper under GST 2.0Earlier, buyers of big petrol and diesel cars paid an effective tax of nearly 50%, comprising 28% GST plus a hefty 22% compensation cess. Under the new system, this has been rationalised to a flat 40% GST.

Markets jump as GST 2.0 lifts consumer-driven stocks. What should investors do?By scrapping the earlier 12% and 28% rates, GST 2.0 promises to simplify compliance and make essentials cheaper. Market participants believe this could set the stage for a consumption revival, with direct benefits for autos, fast-moving consumer goods, cement, housing and financials.

Sensex jumps over 600 points: Why is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex gained nearly 600 points in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 touched 25,900, as investors cheered what is being called GST 2.0.
Sensex jumps 652 points, Nifty above 24,800; Mahindra rises 7%The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 527.86 points to 81,095.39, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 135.65 points to 24,850.70 as of 9:20 am.

Middle class emerges the king as GST 2.0 makes household items cheaperThe GST bonanza will leave more money in the hands of the middle class, which received a substantial tax relief earlier this year after annual income of up to Rs 12 lakh was made tax-free.

Lockheed Martin secures largest-ever Patriot missile order from US ArmyThe Patriot system has long been a cornerstone of US and allied defence strategy. In recent years, its profile has grown after being supplied to Ukraine to counter Russia.

5% GST too low: Montek Singh Ahluwalia bats for single 14% slabEx-Planning Commission deputy chairman Montek Singh Ahluwalia said the GST has too many slabs and cess distortions. He called the 5 per cent slab unsustainable, urging a single 14 per cent rate split between Centre, states and urban local bodies as a "true reform".

GST rates slashed: Big relief for common man; cars, TVs, food items cheaperUnion Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a major GST overhaul following a council meeting, terming it a structural reform for "ease of living".

5% and 18% GST slabs retained, 40% slab for sin goodsGST tax rates on common use items ranging from hair oil to corn flakes, TVs, and personal health and life insurance policies were slashed after the all-powerful GST Council on Wednesday approved a complete overhaul of the tangled Goods and Services Tax regime.

Can GST reforms be a game changer? Montek Singh Ahluwalia respondsIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, former Planning Commission Deputy Chairperson Dr Montek Singh Ahluwalia talked about upcoming GST reforms and pitched for a 14% single rate formula.

GST 2.0 approved: What gets cheaper and costlier from September 22?The 56th meeting of the GST Council approved the abolition of the 12% and 28% slabs, streamlining the regime into just two standard rates – 5% and 18%. A new 40% slab has also been introduced for sin and luxury goods. The reforms will take effect from September 22, the first day of Navratri.

GST 2.0: Check the complete list of goods under 40% sin taxThe new system, called GST 2.0, introduces a simpler two-slab structure and makes several changes to the way goods are taxed. These changes will take effect from 22 September 2025.

No GST on life and health insurance premiums from September 22After the 56th GST Council meeting, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that insurance services, which currently attract 18% GST, will now be fully exempt.

GST on TVs, ACs slashed from 28% to 18%: Nirmala Sitharaman after 56th council meetThe new rates, which include a reduction from 28% to 18% for TVs larger than 32 inches, will come into effect from September 22.

entertainment.headline: Actor Dalljiet Kaur opens up on Shalin Bhanot's absence from son Jaydon's lifeActor Dalljiet Kaur has opened up about former husband Shalin Bhanot's absence from their son Jaydon's life. The actors got married in 2009 and separated in 2015.

Giorgio Armani dies at 91: Leonardo DiCaprio to Sonam Kapoor, celebs pay tributeItalian fashion designer Giorgio Armani died on September 4.He was 91. Many celebrities like Sonam Kapoor, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Reese Witherspoon among others, paid their tributes to the late designer.

Vivek Agnihotri alleges theatres in Bengal threatened against screening The Bengal FilesFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared that his film 'The Bengal Files' cannot be released in West Bengal, and is seeking legal recourse for it.

Hrithik emotional after watching Saba in Songs of Paradise, recalls her strugglesHrithik Roshan was moved by girlfriend Saba Azad's performance in 'Songs of Paradise.' In his heartfelt note, the actor praised her acting and recalled her struggles.

STR 49: Silambarasan steps into Vetri Maaran's Vada Chennai universeThe official glimpse of Vetri Maaran's 'STR 49', starring Silambarasan TR, has been unveiled, promising a gripping new chapter in the 'Vada Chennai' universe.

Baaghi 4 certified A after CBFC cuts violence and adult scenesTiger Shroff's Baaghi 4 receives an A certificate after multiple CBFC cuts for violence and adult content. The film's runtime was shortened voluntarily, highlighting increasing censorship challenges in Bollywood.

Dulquer Salmaan crowns Naslen 'superstar', fans say the prophecy has begunDulquer Salmaan's "superstar" comment about Naslen shows his quick rise in Malayalam cinema. His recent film 'Lokah: Chapter 1' is currently ruling theatres.

Top films and series releasing on Prime Video this weekendRajkummar Rao's 'Maalik' and Vishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa' start streaming on the OTT platform this weekend. Tilly Ramsay's cooking show 'Dish It Out' comes out, and so does K Drama 'Confidence Queen'. Have is a look at the complete list of the latest Prime Video releases.

Singer Karan Aujla confirms performance on The Tonight Show with Jimmy FallonSinger Karan Aujla will perform on 'The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon' this Tuesday. Aujla will be the second Paunjabi singer to appear on the show after Diljit Dosanjh.

Archana Puran Singh's son Aaryamann and Yogita Bihani move in togetherAaryamann Sethi and his fiancee Yogita Bihani have moved in together to a house gifted by Archana Puran Singh and her husband Parmeet Sethi. The couple documented the process of moving in a vlog shared on Aaryamann's YouTube channel.

Majnu Bhai supremacy: Vijay Varma brings home Anil Kapoor's iconic Welcome paintingVijay Varma thrilled Bollywood fans by posing with the iconic Majnu Bhai painting from 'Welcome', reviving a beloved slice of cinematic humour that still brings joy years after its debut.

Punjab floods: Bollywood and Punjabi stars unite for relief effortsBollywood and Punjabi celebrities have stepped up to support flood-affected Punjab with monetary aid and relief efforts. Sonu Sood, Randeep Hooda, and Kapil Sharma extended their help.

Actor Sivakarthikeyan on Madharaasi: It's a Murugadoss film and I am in itAfter the blockbuster success of 'Amaran', Sivakarthikeyan has taken on a new challenge with 'Madharaasi', an action thriller directed by AR Murugadoss. In an interview with India Today, he discussed 'Madharaasi', doing action films, Tamil cinema's quest for a Rs 1000 crore-film and the satisfaction he receives as a producer.

You actor Penn Badgley welcomes identical twin boys with wife Domino KirkeAmerican actor Penn Badgley and wife Domino Kirke have welcomed identical twin sons. The couple shares emotional moments from the pregnancy and reflects on raising twins in today's world.

The Return of Sonu Nigam and the voice Bollywood forgotSonu Nigam makes a powerful return to Bollywood, reviving the magic of melody that the industry has been missing for years. With 'Bijuria' and 'Pardesiya' striking gold, one thing is clear: Nigam is and will always be irreplaceable.

Coolie on OTT: When and where to watch Rajinikanth-Lokesh Kanagaraj's Tamil actionerAfter a spectacular theatrical run, Rajinikanth and Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Coolie' is set for its OTT streaming. The Tamil film, also starring Nagarjuna, Shruti Haasan, and others, will release on Prime Video.

Will Taylor Swift perform at Super Bowl halftime? NFL commissioner respondsNFL commissioner Roger Goodell suggested Taylor Swift's Super Bowl halftime show appearance was "a maybe", heightening anticipation as fans await word from Roc Nation.

Travis Kelce on introducing Taylor Swift as fiancee to colleagues: Pretty coolTravis Kelce recently introduced Taylor Swift as his fiancee to his colleagues. He shared the moment on the 'New Heights' podcast. The player also expressed gratitude for the overwhelming love from fans.

The Paper, The Office spin-off, renewed for Season 2 ahead of September 5 premierePeacock's new sitcom 'The Paper' has been renewed for a second season even before its first episode airs. Featuring a talented cast and veteran creators, the series will begin to stream from September 5.

general news.headline: It's gone now: Ex-US NSA John Bolton says Trump-Modi friendship is historyJohn Bolton says Trump's once-strong personal relationship with Modi is "gone now," warning leaders like UK's Keir Starmer that personal ties with Trump offer no real protection from his unpredictable policies.

Staged it hoping I was watching: Trump jabs Xi over China's huge military showUS President Donald Trump called China's largest military parade impressive but staged to catch his attention. He also faulted Xi Jinping for not mentioning US contributions in World War 2.

How dare you? Video of Ajit Pawar rebuking woman IPS officer goes viralIn the viral video, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar was heard telling IPS officer Anjana Krishna to halt the police crackdown on illegal murrum excavation in Maharashtra's Solapur.

Lawyer named Mark Zuckerberg sues Mark Zuckerberg after Facebook keeps banning himAn American lawyer who shares his name with Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg has sued Meta, saying the company wrongly kept blocking his account for impersonation. Here is everything you need to know.

Why pizza orders were tracked amid Trump is Dead buzzEarlier this week, when speculation over Donald Trump's alleged death was swirling, the Pentagon Pizza Index surged by 800%. Pizza orders near the Pentagon—the headquarters of the US Defence Department—are considered a barometer, hinting at officials at work for hours, during a crunch situation. This was also the case in June when the US bombed Iran. Even Soviet spies kept an eye on pizza orders during the Cold War.

Student, 20, found dead at BITS Pilani Goa campus, 5th such case in 10 monthsA 20-year-old student was found dead in his hostel room at BITS Pilani campus in Goa. This is the fifth such incident since December last year.
How will you invest in US? Trump presses tech titans at White House dinnerAt a White House dinner with top tech CEOs, Donald Trump pressed Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft on their US investments.

Row erupts over 'Halal lifestyle township' project near MumbaiA promotional video for a housing project near Mumbai has sparked a row, with political parties alleging it promotes exclusivity on religious lines.

Want to get rich on X? Product Head Nikita Bier says post daily for 6 monthsNikita Bier, X's Product Head, shared key advice on how to earn on social media. He encourages users to be consistent and include niche information in their posts.
Monsoon fury: India registered 48% above-normal rain last weekBetween August 28 and September 3, India received 75.2 mm of rain, as against the normal of 49 mm, marking a surplus of 48%.

Trump hosts powerful tech CEOs for White House dinner; Elon Musk not invitedPresident Donald Trump hosted tech leaders, including Gates, Cook, Zuckerberg and Pichai for a White House dinner, with AI policy in focus. Elon Musk, once an ally, was notably absent.

Oracle, Salesforce cut hundreds of jobs in US as tech layoffs drag on: ReportIn filings with state regulators, the two software giants disclosed plans to eliminate more than 500 jobs in the Bay Area and nearly 200 in the Seattle region. Salesforce is cutting 262 roles in San Francisco, while Oracle is eliminating 254 jobs spread across Redwood City, Pleasanton and Santa Clara.

Asia Cup 2025: How India can reach the final in Rajgir? Scenarios explainedThe Super 4s stage is wide open, but India holds the advantage over the rest following their 4-1 win against Malaysia on Thursday, September 4. Here's what all four teams need to make it to the final of the Asia Cup on Sunday.

India must play key role in ending Ukraine war, EU leaders tell PM ModiPM Modi held a joint call with EU leaders, discussed trade, security, and Ukraine, invited them to India for the next summit, and reaffirmed his commitment to strengthen the India-EU strategic partnership.

Messi scores twice in Argentina's 3-0 win in emotional home farewellLionel Messi struck twice as Argentina defeated Venezuela 3-0 on Thursday in what marked the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner's final World Cup qualifier on home soil.
How rainy-day traffic broke Gurugram's urban prideThe September 1 snarl is a reminder of the perils of big cities built without holistically addressing the ecological aspects of habitation.

Vivek Agnihotri alleges theatres in Bengal threatened against screening The Bengal FilesFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared that his film 'The Bengal Files' cannot be released in West Bengal, and is seeking legal recourse for it.

GST cuts drive auto sector rally: Top stocks to keep on your radarWith the festive season approaching, experts believe that automobile companies will be among the biggest winners of the recent rate cuts in GST.

Meet 7 Indian teachers quietly changing the country's classroomsEducation is not just about exams or grades — it is the real measure of how our future will unfold.  On Teacher's Day, here are seven Indian teachers who have transformed classrooms with simple yet powerful ideas -- from QR codes and wall blackboards to feminist pedagogy -- changing the lives of millions of students across villages and towns. They deserve to become household names.

Little feet, big journeys: Your complete guide to travelling with a babyTravelling with a baby does feel overwhelming, no matter if it's your first time or your hundredth. But with the right tips and preparation, you can navigate every journey with ease and confidence.

Sugar is sin: Why India's new GST reform hits your cola harder than cigarettesFor the first time, sugary drinks like colas, iced teas, and energy drinks face a steep 40% GST, alongside tobacco and alcohol. Here's why sugar is India's newest "sin" and what it means for your health.

What after Armani: The way ahead for iconic Italian fashion empireGiorgio Armani, who died at 91 leaving no children, built one of the world's most iconic fashion brands and ensured its future independence through a foundation.

Rajasthan man kills cousin over 'affair with wife', buries body with own excavatorAccording to police, Sohanram killed his cousin Mukesh over suspicion of an affair with his wife. Mukesh's body was recovered from a 10-foot-deep pit in Sohanram's mine.

Andhra man kills 3 children, sets them ablaze, later dies by suicide in TelanganaA 36-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh allegedly killed his three children and later died by suicide in Telangana. Police suspect marital discord and emotional distress as the motive behind the crime.

sports.headline: Asia Cup Hockey daily digest: India sing redemption song in Rajgir, inch closer to finalThe Indian team produced a stunning performance to come back from a goal down to beat Malaysia 4-1 and take a big step towards qualifying for the Asia Cup 2025 final. But familiar foes in the form of China awaits Harmanpreet Singh and his side with all four teams retaining a chance to make it to the summit clash. Alan John joins hands with veteran sports journalist Sundeep Misra for the analysis of the second round of the Super 4s and the final set of matches of the phase on September 6.

Jatinder Singh eyes Asia Cup glory: From Punjab's soil to Oman's prideJatinder Singh, the Ludhiana-born cricketer who now captains Oman, spoke to India Today in an exclusive interview about the team's preparations for the upcoming Asia Cup and the challenges that arose after a pay dispute with 11 players following the T20 World Cup.

Lionel Messi remains coy on Argentina future: I haven't decided about World CupLionel Messi said he has not yet decided if he will play at the 2026 World Cup after scoring twice in Argentina's 3-0 win over Venezuela in Buenos Aires, his last World Cup qualifier at home.

Suryakumar, Hardik join coach Gambhir as India squad arrives in DubaiAsia Cup 2025: India players and head coach Gautam Gambhir arrived in Dubai on Thursday evening. The team will hold its first training session on Friday, five days before their tournament opener against the UAE.

Ross Taylor ends retirement to play for Samoa: NZ great's decision explainedRoss Taylor has reversed his retirement to represent Samoa in the 2026 T20 World Cup qualifier. The 41-year-old said he is still fit enough to run around and is keen on boosting the profile of cricket in Samoa.

Daniel Levy steps down as Tottenham Hotspur chairman after divisive 25-year tenureDaniel Levy has stepped down as Tottenham Hotspur chairman, the club announced on Thursday, bringing an end to a nearly 25-year tenure marked by financial stability but a lack of major silverware.

Molineux set to make return as Australia name squad for Women's ODI World CupSophie Molineux has been named in Australia's 15-player squad for the ODI World Cup in India and Sri Lanka and is expected to be fit in time. Leg-spinner Georgia Wareham has also recovered from the injury that cut short her Hundred campaign.

Breetzke sets ODI world record to help South Africa clinch series win vs EnglandSouth Africa's Matthew Breetzke became the first player to score half-centuries in each of his first five ODI appearances, setting up his side's gripping, series-clinching five-run victory over England at Lord's on Thursday.

Sabalenka battles past Jessica Pegula to keep US Open title defence aliveWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka kept her US Open title defence alive on Thursday, rallying to beat American Jessica Pegula 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 in their semi-final clash. The Belarusian recovered from a shaky opening set in a rematch of last year's final, silencing the partisan Arthur Ashe Stadium crowd before overpowering the fourth seed with 43 winners and eight aces.

Scenarios explainedThe Super 4s stage is wide open, but India holds the advantage over the rest following their 4-1 win against Malaysia on Thursday, September 4. Here's what all four teams need to make it to the final of the Asia Cup on Sunday.

Leg-spinner Georgia Wareham has also recovered from the injury that cut short her Hundred campaign.

Sabalenka battles past Jessica Pegula to keep US Open title defence aliveWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka kept her US Open title defence alive on Thursday, rallying to beat American Jessica Pegula 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 in their semi-final clash. The Belarusian recovered from a shaky opening set in a rematch of last year's final, silencing the partisan Arthur Ashe Stadium crowd before overpowering the fourth seed with 43 winners and eight aces.

Asia Cup 2025: How India can reach the final in Rajgir? Scenarios explainedThe Super 4s stage is wide open, but India holds the advantage over the rest following their 4-1 win against Malaysia on Thursday, September 4. Here's what all four teams need to make it to the final of the Asia Cup on Sunday.

Messi scores twice in Argentina's 3-0 win in emotional home farewellLionel Messi struck twice as Argentina defeated Venezuela 3-0 on Thursday in what marked the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner's final World Cup qualifier on home soil.

US Open: Yuki Bhambri's dream run ends with semifinal loss in men's doublesUS Open 2025: India's Yuki Bhambri and his KIwi partner Michael Venus were knocked out in the men's doubles semi-final after a three-set battle against higher-ranked Joe Salisbury and Neil Skupski.

Semi-finals Live Updates: Anisimova outlasts Osaka, sets up final vs SabalenkaUS Open 2025, semi-finals Live Updates: Amanda Anisimova is through to the final. She outlasts Naomi Osaka, ending the former champion's resurgent run. Anisimova will face World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka in the final. Earlier in the day, Sabalenka defeated Jessica Pegula in three sets in the first semi-final.

Pakistan recover from Afghanistan shocker to qualify for tri-series finalPakistan bounced back from an earlier loss to reach the tri-series final by defeating UAE by 31 runs in Sharjah. The victory sets up a high-stakes final against Afghanistan, highlighting strong performances from Fakhar Zaman and Abrar Ahmed.

Punjab Kings donate ₹33.8 lakh to support flood relief in PunjabIndian Premier League (IPL) franchise Punjab Kings (PBKS) has come out in support of the flood victims in Punjab by donating Rs 33.8 lakh in relief funds.

Aryna Sabalenka vs Jessica Pegula semi-final: When and where to watch?Aryna Sabalenka and Jessica Pegula will clash in the US Open 2025 semifinal in a highly anticipated rematch. Pegula aims to avenge last year's final loss on home soil, adding extra drama to the contest.

Shreya Ghoshal to perform at ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 opening ceremonyShreya Ghoshal will perform at the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 opening ceremony in Guwahati. The event promises affordable tickets and a vibrant celebration of women's cricket, boosting fan engagement across India.

Asia Cup 2025: India thrash Malaysia with comeback win as final race heats upIndia secured a sensational comeback win against Malaysia as the race to the final in the Asia Cup 2025 heats up in Rajgir. China's win over Korea has left the Super 4s wide open, with all four teams still having the chance to make it to the final.

Women's World Cup: ICC announces cheapest-ever tickets, prices as low as Rs 100The International Cricket Council (ICC) announced ticket sales for the Women's World Cup 2025 at a record low price for any global ICC event.

Aryna Sabalenka vs Jessica Pegula semi-final: When and where to watch?Aryna Sabalenka and Jessica Pegula will clash in the US Open 2025 semifinal in a highly anticipated rematch. Pegula aims to avenge last year's final loss on home soil, adding extra drama to the contest.

Shreya Ghoshal to perform at ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 opening ceremonyShreya Ghoshal will perform at the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 opening ceremony in Guwahati. The event promises affordable tickets and a vibrant celebration of women's cricket, boosting fan engagement across India.

China's win over Korea has left the Super 4s wide open, with all four teams still having the chance to make it to the final.

Women's World Cup: ICC announces cheapest-ever tickets, prices as low as Rs 100The International Cricket Council (ICC) announced ticket sales for the Women's World Cup 2025 at a record low price for any global ICC event.

Salah bids farewell to Harvey Elliot after Liverpool exit: You leave as championMohammed Salah has penned a heartfelt post on social media to honour the contributions of Harvey Elliott who now leaves the club to join Aston Villa

Shafali ignored again as India name Yastika Bhatia's replacement for World CupIndia Women's cricket team has drafted Assam batter Uma Chetry as a replacement for the injured Yastika Bhatia ahead of the ODI series against Australia and the upcoming World Cup. Shafali Verma again didn't find a spot in the 50-over squad since last playing back in October 2024.

CAFA Nations Cup: India qualify for third-place match at expense of TajikistanThe Indian football team secured a berth in the CAFA Nations Cup third-place match on head-to-head record after tournament co-hosts Tajikistan and Iran played out a 2-2 draw here on Thursday.

India vs Malaysia, Hockey Asia Cup Highlights : India secures 4-1 vs MalaysiaIndia vs Malaysia, Hockey Asia Cup Highlights: India produced their best performance in the tournament as they took down the unbeaten Malaysia with a 4-1 comeback win in the Super Four stage.

After maiden Test call-up, N Jagadeesan lights up Duleep Trophy with centuryNarayan Jagadeesan scored a sensational century on Day 1 of the first Duleep Trophy semi-final, scoring an unbeaten 148* (260) for South Zone against North Zone.

Bhambri and Venus face defending champs in US Open 2025 semifinalYuki Bhambri and Michael Venus have reached the US Open 2025 men's doubles semifinals. Their upcoming match against British defending champions could mark a historic moment for Indian tennis.

Mishra breaks silence on selection bias: Being in and out of team frustrated meFormer India leg spinner Amit Mishra revealed how it was frustrating for him to be constantly in and out of the Indian team, during his playing teams.

Duleep Trophy: CSK skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad proves red-ball mettle with 184 in semisRuturaj Gaikwad continues to showcase his class in red-ball cricket after his stellar 184-run knock in the Duleep Trophy semis against Central Zone. His knock propelled the West Zone to put a fighting first-innings total.

Pakistan captain takes inspiration from MS Dhoni ahead of Women's World CupPakistan women's cricket team captain Fatima Sana revealed that she's taking inspiration from MS Dhoni ahead of the Women's Cricket World Cup 2025.

Amit Mishra announces retirement from all forms of cricketFormer India wrist spinner Amit Mishra has announced his retirement from all forms of cricket. Mishra last played for India in 2017 and IPL in 2024.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
